pullRequest.body:
Add Dockerfiles for lean and mathlib

---

Based off https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib3/tree/master/.docker. Also modifies the current gitpod Dockerfile so that leanblueprint works out-of-the-box.

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [2373131190](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15936/commits/23731311908c0e90dfb1719708e30f1a9d9bc6ae)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

I added a -4 suffix to the names of the images, and added automatic date tags.
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f0643157-5c0e-433b-90f6-392f5b4c5572)
This also unifies the `lean4` and `mathlib4` images, which differed only in a single ssh call (to bypass the fingerprint check), and splits `gitpod4` from `gitpod4-blueprint`, the latter of which has a TeXLive installation and leanblueprint. We also need to check if it makes sense to include xelatex in the latter, because it seems to be widely used.

I think we should get this in now. Our dockerhub is already using these new images

maintainer merge
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.
Also, please merge `master` and document the two new scripts in `scripts/README.md`, per our new linter in #14539.

I have just updated [our Dockerhub images](https://hub.docker.com/repository/docker/leanprovercommunity/) using the two new scripts in this PR. Everything works as intended when I open the LeanAPAP repo (which points to the `leanprovercommunity/mathlib:gitpod` image).

@eric-wieser, can you make sure you too are happy with the changes?
Why do we want `texlive` for mathlib? This makes the image quite a bit bigger.
Maybe we should make two tags: one that includes a copy of leanblueprint and its dependencies (such as TeXLive), and one that does not.
This is because we want it for blueprints. But maybe that should be an extra tag/dockerhub repo

Maybe
```suggestion
# check with kim@tqft.net for credentials.
```
@kim-em Do you want your email here at all? Maybe just pointing to Zulip is enough?

pullRequest.title: feat: add Dockerfiles for lean and mathlib

```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

I have just updated [our Dockerhub images](https://hub.docker.com/repository/docker/leanprovercommunity/) using the two new scripts in this PR. Everything works as intended when I open the LeanAPAP repo (which points to the `leanprovercommunity/mathlib:gitpod` image).

@eric-wieser, can you make sure you too are happy with the changes?

I added a -4 suffix to the names of the images, and added automatic date tags.
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f0643157-5c0e-433b-90f6-392f5b4c5572)
This also unifies the `lean4` and `mathlib4` images, which differed only in a single ssh call (to bypass the fingerprint check), and splits `gitpod4` from `gitpod4-blueprint`, the latter of which has a TeXLive installation and leanblueprint. We also need to check if it makes sense to include xelatex in the latter, because it seems to be widely used.

I think we should get this in now. Our dockerhub is already using these new images

maintainer merge
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.
Also, please merge `master` and document the two new scripts in `scripts/README.md`, per our new linter in #14539.
